feed.title: Google Cloud: Vertex AI Workbench
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Vertex AI Workbench

entry.content:
M134 release

The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Patched a regression with custom notebook metrics reporting (for example, jupyterlab_kernels and docker_status metrics).
  • Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (dataproc-jupyter-plugin) to version 0.1.92.
  • When using Google Cloud CLI commands, the project and region properties are preset.
entry.summary: The M134 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes important updates such as a fix for custom notebook metrics reporting and an updated Dataproc JupyterLab plugin. Additionally, Google Cloud CLI commands now have preset 'project' and 'region' properties for improved user experience.
entry.title: Feature: M134 Release Notes

entry.content: Generally available (GA): You can use Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Workforce Identity Federation lets you create and manage Vertex AI Workbench instances with credentials provided by an external identity provider (IdP). For more information, see Create an instance with third party credentials.
entry.summary: You can now use Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench instances. This feature allows you to manage Vertex AI Workbench instances using credentials from an external identity provider.
entry.title: Feature: Workforce Identity Federation with Vertex AI Workbench

entry.content:
M133 release

The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Patched an incompatibility with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (dataproc-jupyter-plugin) and instances with end-user credentials enabled.
entry.summary: The M133 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances resolves an incompatibility issue with the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin for instances using end-user credentials.
entry.title: Feature: M133 Release Notes

entry.content:
M132 release

The M132 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • The new scheduler Jupyter plugin (scheduler-jupyter-plugin) is now preinstalled in the Jupyterlab 4 environment, with support for both the Cloud Composer and Vertex AI notebook schedulers.
  • Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin (dataproc-jupyter-plugin) to version 0.1.90.
  • Patched bugs related to the managed end user credentials feature (Preview), resolving an incompatibility with listing Dataproc remote kernels.
  • Patched a bug that caused instances with disabled proxy access to get stuck in provisioning.
  • Removed the archived Debian 11 backports repository, resolving an issue with running apt update within the instance.
entry.summary: The M132 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances is here, featuring a new Jupyter plugin for scheduling and bug fixes.
entry.title: Feature: M132 Release

entry.content: Generally available: You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see Use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances.
entry.summary: You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run.
entry.title: Feature: Vertex AI Workbench now supports reservations

entry.content:
M131 release

The M131 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.89.
entry.summary: The M131 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances features an update to the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.89.
entry.title: Feature: M131 Release Update

entry.content:
M130 release

The M130 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:

  • Updated the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin to version 0.1.87.
  • Added the BigQuery JupyterLab plugin, version 0.0.1.
  • The GOOGLE_CLOUD_REGION environment variable is now set by default.
entry.summary: The M130 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances introduces the BigQuery JupyterLab plugin and updates the Dataproc JupyterLab plugin. Additionally, the GOOGLE_CLOUD_REGION environment variable is now set by default.
entry.title: Feature: Vertex AI Workbench M130 release

entry.content: Available in Preview: You can consume reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances. Reservations of Compute Engine zonal resources help you gain a high level of assurance that your jobs have the necessary resources to run. For more information, see Use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances.
entry.summary: You can now use reservations with Vertex AI Workbench instances to ensure your jobs have the necessary resources. This feature is available in Preview and helps you gain a high level of assurance for your resource needs.
entry.title: Feature: Reservations available for Vertex AI Workbench
